org.mitre.tdp.boogie

Interface Leg


  • public interface Leg
    Defines the core fieldset of a procedure leg. Combinations of these features are used when determining how to fly legs of a particular type. In general though for most leg types the majority of these will be null, and are hence optional in the signature. The exceptions to this are the pathTerminator since it is widely used (although it may also be nullable for certain leg types) and the legType which is required.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Optional<? extends Constraint> altitudeConstraint()
      The altitude constraint at the pathTerminator().
      java.util.Optional<? extends Fix> centerFix()
      For leg types which define arcs as a constant radius turn between fixes this will contain the information about the center of that turn.
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> distance()
      The required distance of flight if required by the leg.
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> inboundMagneticCourse()
      The inbound magnetic course to one of the listed fixes in the leg description.
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> outboundMagneticCourse()
      The outbound magnetic course to one of the listed fixes in the leg description.
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.Boolean> overfly()
      Indicates whether the leg should be overflown at the path terminator.
      Fix pathTerminator()
      The path terminator for the leg if said leg ends in a concrete fix.
      java.util.Optional<? extends Fix> recommendedNavaid()
      If the leg requires a navaid to be flown correctly this field will contain the pertinent information about that navaid.
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> rho()
      For legs with a recommended navaid this is the distance in nm to that navaid.
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> rnp()
      The Required Navigational Performance (RNP) needed to fly the leg.
      java.lang.Integer sequenceNumber()
      The sequence number of the leg.
      java.util.Optional<? extends Constraint> speedConstraint()
      The speed constraint at the pathTerminator().
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> theta()
      For legs with a recommended navaid this is the magnetic bearing to that navaid.
      java.util.Optional<TurnDirection> turnDirection()
      If the leg contains a turn this indicates the direction of the turn or both if either is viable.
      LegType type()
      The LegType of the leg.
      java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> verticalAngle()
      The vertical angle identifies the vertical navigation path for the procedure.

    • Method Detail

      • pathTerminator

        Fix pathTerminator()
        The path terminator for the leg if said leg ends in a concrete fix. e.g. for a TF (track-to-fix) leg this will be a navaid or a waypoint e.g. for a CA (course-to-altitude) leg this will be null since the termination point is at a (altitude) constraint rather than a position.

      • recommendedNavaid

        java.util.Optional<? extends Fix> recommendedNavaid()
        If the leg requires a navaid to be flown correctly this field will contain the pertinent information about that navaid. e.g. for a FA (fix to altitude) this will be the fix the outbound course will be with reference to for climbing to the target altitude.

      • centerFix

        java.util.Optional<? extends Fix> centerFix()
        For leg types which define arcs as a constant radius turn between fixes this will contain the information about the center of that turn.

      • type

        LegType type()
        The LegType of the leg. It indicates how the leg is to be flown.

      • sequenceNumber

        java.lang.Integer sequenceNumber()
        The sequence number of the leg. This represents the position of the leg in the procedure/airway which references it. Sorting legs by sequence number within an airway or procedure should produce the full path as intended by the procedure designer.

      • inboundMagneticCourse

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> inboundMagneticCourse()
        The inbound magnetic course to one of the listed fixes in the leg description.

      • outboundMagneticCourse

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> outboundMagneticCourse()
        The outbound magnetic course to one of the listed fixes in the leg description.

      • rho

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> rho()
        For legs with a recommended navaid this is the distance in nm to that navaid.

      • theta

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> theta()
        For legs with a recommended navaid this is the magnetic bearing to that navaid.

      • rnp

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> rnp()
        The Required Navigational Performance (RNP) needed to fly the leg.

      • distance

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> distance()
        The required distance of flight if required by the leg.

      • verticalAngle

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Double> verticalAngle()
        The vertical angle identifies the vertical navigation path for the procedure.

      • speedConstraint

        java.util.Optional<? extends Constraint> speedConstraint()
        The speed constraint at the pathTerminator().

      • altitudeConstraint

        java.util.Optional<? extends Constraint> altitudeConstraint()
        The altitude constraint at the pathTerminator().

      • turnDirection

        java.util.Optional<TurnDirection> turnDirection()
        If the leg contains a turn this indicates the direction of the turn or both if either is viable.

      • overfly

        java.util.Optional<java.lang.Boolean> overfly()
        Indicates whether the leg should be overflown at the path terminator.
